text.p: Duch chemicals group DSM said on Wednesday it would build a second glyoxilic acid plant at DSM Chemie Linz in Austria.
The plant will have a capacity of 7,500 tonnes per year and should come on stream in the first quarter of 1999. This will double DSM Fine Chemicals' glyoxilic acid capacity.

"The construction of a second glyoxilic acid plant will reinforce DSM Chemie Linz's strong position as a supplier of this product. The glyoxilic market is experiencing strong annual growth of around five percent," DSM said in a statement.
Glyoxilic acid is used mainly in drugs and for flavours and fragrants.
DSM Chemie Linz was acquired by DSM in early 1996 and has annual sales of over 400 million guilders.
No financial details of the new plant construction were given.
